title.narrative: SECONDARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2025, the formal education system has increased capacity to ensure access, retention and relevant quality learning opportunities for adolescent girls and boys, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the most vulnerable and at-risk adolescents and young people are learning, acquiring relevant skills, and participating meaningfully in an environment that is safe and responsive to the needs of both girls and boys.

participating-org.narrative: MEB MTE GM CIRAKLIK EGIT OLCME DEG MILLI EGITIM BAKANLIGI MEB MESLEKI TEKNIK EGITIM GENEL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, the formal education system has increased capacity to ensure access, retention and relevant quality learningopportunities for adolescent girls and boys

description.narrative: UNICEF continued strengthening the inclusivity of the formal education system through programmes aiming to ensure that all adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, including refugees (Syrians and other nationalities), have equitable access to education opportunities to acquire the knowledge and skills they need to thrive in life. UNICEF continues to support the delivery of outreach activities, and education-focused case management services to identify, support and enrol refugee children in age-appropriate relevant educational opportunities. Support is also provided to enable out-of-school adolescents’ transition back to formal schooling, by enrolling them in vocational education and training and enhancing their job-readiness skills. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Status of framework for enhancing life-skills relevant to adolescent boys and girls in the formal secondary education curriculum, Text

baseline.value: Life skills embedded in the compulsory education curricula in an inconsistent manner

target.value: 2025:Revised life-skills framework developed, adopted at all secondary schools nationwide.

actual.value: 2021:Relevant curricula mapped and analyzed in terms of skills development as per UNICEF LSCE Framework.

title.narrative: Status of framework for enhancing life-skills relevant to adolescent boys and girls in the formal secondary education curriculum, Text

baseline.value: Life skills embedded in the compulsory education curricula in an inconsistent manner

target.value: 2025:Revised life-skills framework developed, adopted at all secondary schools nationwide.

title.narrative: Status of monitoring mechanism to track vulnerable students at risk of dropout, Text

baseline.value: monitoring mechanism in place however use of the data at school to track vulnerable students at risk of dropping out is limited

target.value: 2025:Monitoring mechanism regularly identifies vulnerable students at risk of dropping out and informs timely interventions

actual.value: 2021:Revision of the current monitoring mechanism (with technical discussions) is ongoing.

title.narrative: Status of programmes to improve school retention for at-risk adolescent boys and girls, Text

baseline.value: support programmes exist but are insufficient to address the existing barriers related to retention and early school leaving

actual.value: 2021:Programme design and development (technical consultation process and the needs analysis) is ongoing with MoNE.
